Abstract:
The level-4 MODIS global Leaf Area Index (LAI) and Fraction of Photosynthetically Active Radiation (FPAR) product is composited every 8 days at 1-kilometer resolution on a Sinusoidal grid. The MCD15A2 product includes the following Science Data Sets: LAI, FPAR, and a set of quality rating, and standard deviation layers for each variable.

The LAI variable defines the number of equivalent layers of leaves relative to a unit of ground area, whereas FPAR measures the proportion of available radiation in the photosynthetically-active wavelengths that are absorbed by green vegetation. Both variables are used as satellite-derived parameters to calculate surface photosynthesis, evapotranspiration, and net primary production, which inputs are used to calculate terrestrial energy, carbon, water-cycle processes, and vegetation biogeochemistry.

Change Points of Interest

Algorithm refinements were targeted to improve quality of LAI/FPAR retrievals, and consistency with field measurements over all biomes, but with major focus on woody vegetation.
Old 6-biome LAI/FPAR map was replaced with a new 8-biome map (broadleaf and needleleaf forest classes were split into deciduous and evergreen subclasses)
LAI/FPAR algorithm LUTs refined for all 8 biomes
Reduced file volume through internal compression
Additional V005 LAI/FPAR changes: http://landweb.nascom.nasa.gov/QA_WWW/forPage/C005_Changes_LAI_FPAR.pdf

V005 Data Set Characteristics:
Temporal Coverage: July 4, 2002 – March 29, 2017 
Area: ~10 degrees x 10 degrees lat/long 
Image Dimensions: 1200 x 1200 rows/columns 
Spatial Resolution: 1 km 
File Size: 2 MB
Resolution: ~1000 meters 
Projection: Sinusoidal 
Data Format: HDF-EOS
Science Data Sets (SDS HDF Layers): 6

LP DAAC Data Pool provides direct access to all currently available MODIS products and the ability to download them via HTTP.

The MODIS Reprojection Tool on the Web (MRTWeb) is available for selected MODIS land products.  MRTWeb’s capabilities include reprojecting to alternate map projections, spatial and spectral subsetting, resampling, and alternate output format options.

USGS EarthExplorer (EE) provides users the ability to query, search and order archived ASTER and MODIS products available from the LP DAAC.  Registered users of EE have access to additional features than guest users.

The USGS Global Visualization Viewer (GloVis) is an online search and order tool driven by browse images.  Users may select any geographical area of interest (for any given product) and view all available browse images for that area before deciding to order those products.
